DOC.brief_summary: It has been demonstrated that EPA and DHA supplementation may have anti-inflammatory properties in several chronic diseases, namely, diabetes, obesity, and in rheumatoid arthritis, although not with controversy. Systemic lupus erythematosus is an autoimmune disease characterized by a chronic inflammatory state which is associated with the disease´s clinical symptoms. Thus, we hypothesized that EPA and DHA supplementation may beneficially affect the inflammatory cytokine profile and clinical features of LES patients.
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy of EPA and DHA Supplementation in Systemic Lupus Erythematosus
DOC.criteria: Age between 7 and 40 years SLEDAI ≤ 4 Cardiovascular dysfunction Rhythm and conduction disorders Musculoskeletal disturbances Kidney and pulmonary involvements Peripheral neuropathy Use of tobacco Treatment with lipidlowering or hypoglycemic drugs Fibromyalgia Use of chronotropic or antihypertensive drugs Physically active subjects
